medical_history.chief_complaint: Poor memory and difficulty with cognitive functioning along with mood swings and seizures.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. C's symptoms likely date back to birth, starting with a 'foggy feeling' in his head he recalls. Over the years, he experienced intermittent abdominal pains and progressive difficulties in memory and cognitive task management. His cognitive and affective symptoms worsened again after a suicide attempt in graduate school, leading to additional medical management. In recent years, he experienced sleep deprivation and stress which exacerbated his symptoms, particularly during the winter months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History includes cholecystectomy, tonsillectomy/adenoidectomy, ACL repair, hernia repair, history of suicide attempt, and ongoing treatment for epilepsy and psychiatric issues.
medical_history.family_history: Notable for affective disorder in paternal and maternal forebears, including a parent with left temporal dysfunction and a sibling with affective disorder.
medical_history.social_history: Mr. C has consumed very little alcohol and has a history of smoking cigarettes in the past. He works part-time and lives near Boston with his wife.
